summary: This bill designates the America's National Churchill Museum, located at Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri, as a National Historic Landmark. It authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to enter into cooperative agreements for protecting historic resources and providing educational programs. The Secretary is also mandated to conduct a special resource study to evaluate the Landmark's national significance and the feasibility of its inclusion in the National Park System. The study must be completed within 3 years and reported to relevant congressional committees.
